intro: Delphinium beesianum var. beesianum, commonly known as the alpine larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring tall, unbranched stems that bear clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its striking appearance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine collections.
